meanings.definition: To voluntarily leave a job or position.
meanings.sent1: She resigns from her job to spend more time with her family.
meanings.sent2: He resigns as the team captain after many years of service.
meanings.sent3: The clown resigns from the circus to pursue a career in magic.
meanings.sent4: The old tree resigns its leaves in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The tired soldier resigns his post and heads home for a well-deserved rest.

meanings.definition: To accept that something undesirable cannot be avoided.
meanings.sent1: He resigns to the fact that he will have to work overtime this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She resigns to the reality that her favorite show has been canceled.
meanings.sent3: The cat resigns to wearing a silly costume for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The student resigns to the idea of studying all night for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The hiker resigns to the rain and continues the trek with a smile.

meanings.definition: To give up or relinquish control or power.
meanings.sent1: The king resigns his throne to his son and retires in peace.
meanings.sent2: She resigns her authority to the new leader with grace.
meanings.sent3: The magician resigns his magic wand to the young apprentice.
meanings.sent4: The sun resigns its brightness as the moon takes over the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The CEO resigns control of the company to focus on philanthropic endeavors.
